entry.title: Blockchain Takes Center Stage At 2024 Global Data Ecosystem Conference In Shanghai
entry.summary:
This year’s Global Data Ecosystem Conference, held in Pudong New Area, Shanghai, has ended positively. The two-day tech conference was extra special because it focused on popular blockchain technology, related applications, and other emerging innovations.
Over 30 events were held during the conference, covering various topics, including blockchain technology, international data cooperation, data and its value to industries, and an initiative to connect data service providers. Shanghai was the perfect host for the global conference, which organizers expect can lead to exploring new data and blockchain technologies.
Global Data Ecosystem Conference Highlights The Digital Economy

entry.title: FCA Has No Intention of Easing Its "Too Tough" Approach to Crypto Regulations
entry.summary: The UK's Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) has defended its “too tough” approach to registering cryptocurrency firms, arguing that robust standards are essential for building a sustainable and trustworthy digital asset sector. In a statement released today (Monday), Val Smith, Head of Payments and Digital Assets at the FCA's authorizations division, addressed criticism that the regulator's stringent requirements could potentially stifle innovation in the crypto industry and that the bar for registration is set “too high.” Crypto Companies Want to Build on Sand. FCA Wants to Build on “Sturdy Foundations” "Innovations built quickly on unsafe, unregulated and untrusted foundations become a house built on sand – likely to collapse," Smith warned. "Instead, we want to clos…

entry.title: Elon Musk Speaks Out On XRP: A Game Changer For Crypto?
entry.summary:
Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla and SpaceX, directly mentioned XRP for the first time during a Town Hall meeting in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. The dialogue unfolded when an attendee, seemingly a supporter, asked Musk: “Do you envision the XRP Ledger being incorporated into financial institutions in the future?”
He responded thoughtfully: “I do think that cryptocurrency is an interesting and probably valuable bulwark against centralized control.” Musk, who has to be careful what he says in public due to his reach and popularity, apparently tried to avoid any misunderstandings and interpretations, which is why he clarified further, “this is definitely not an endorsement or lack of endorsement for XRP.”
The Tesla CEO further added, “but I do think crypto by its very nature helps with individual fr…

entry.title: Crypto Tax Reform On The Horizon? Japan’s Tamaki Pledges Change If Elected
entry.summary:
The crypto industry is buzzing this year, not just because of new memes, coin pumping, or Bitcoin leading another bull run. It’s now a hotly debated election issue, dividing the electorate and promising to bring the industry to new heights. And we’re not just talking about the US elections and Trump’s pro-crypto stance; digital currency as an election issue has spilled over to Japan, where it’s scheduled to hold its general elections this October 27th.
Yuichiro Tamaki, the leader of the Democratic Party for the People (DPP), has recently promised tax cuts and reforms as part of the party’s efforts to shore up support. Posting on his official Twitter/X account, Tamaki shared that his party is pursuing crypto-friendly tax policies, offering tax cuts of up to 20%.
In a translated X po…

entry.title: ECB Paper Is A ‘Declaration Of War’ Against Bitcoin, Warns Expert
entry.summary:
In a stark critique of the European Central Bank’s latest research, prominent analyst Tuur Demeester has labeled the ECB’s new publication as a “true declaration of war” against Bitcoin. The ECB’s paper, titled “The Distributional Consequences of Bitcoin,” authored by Ulrich Bindseil and Jürgen Schaaf, has ignited a fervent response from the BTC community.
The ECB’s paper challenges the foundational premise of Bitcoin by arguing that its appreciation does not contribute to the productive capacity of the economy. Instead, the paper posits that a sustained increase in BTC’s value leads to redistributive effects, where the consumption and wealth accumulation of early holders potentially impoverish non-holders and latecomers.
The authors assert, “If the price of Bitcoin rises for good, the…

entry.title: Stripe Strikes Biggest Ever Crypto Deal: TechCrunch Founder Confirms Bridge Acquisition
entry.summary: Stripe, a US-headquartered payment processing firm, has sealed the acquisition deal for Bridge, a fintech startup specialising in moving money using stablecoins like Tether’s USDT and Circle’s USDC, by paying $1.1 billion, TechCrunch founder Michael Arrington confirmed. However, the companies are yet to make an official statement. Largest Crypto Deal to Date The $1.1 billion price tag makes this the largest acquisition in the cryptocurrency space to date. Other recent major industry deals include CoinShares’ acquisition of Valkyrie Funds for $530 million and Robinhood’s purchase of Bitstamp for $200 million. The confirmation of Stripe’s acquisition of Bridge came only a couple of days after a Bloomberg report revealed that the two companies were in advanced talks. However, the report highl…

EIGEN, OP, APT lead token unlocks this week.

entry.title: How Walrus Protocol Unlocks New Applications for Decentralized Data Storage
entry.summary: Mysten Labs Chief Scientist George Danezis joined Decrypt to talk about its new decentralized storage protocol Walrus, which promises to unlock new applications such as AI and social media, thanks to its novel Red Stuff data encoding algorithm.

entry.title: Why Coinbase Sees Crypto as a Bipartisan, 'Purple' Political Issue
entry.summary: Coinbase VP of Corporate and Business Development, Shan Aggarwal, joined Decrypt's Sander Lutz and Liz Napolitano at Messari Mainnet 2024 to discuss the exchange's efforts to grow mainstream crypto adoption—and how the changing political conversation around digital assets is rapidly playing a major role in that.

entry.title: Binance Is Playing Offense—Not Just Defense—Against Crypto Crime, Says Head of Financial Investigations
entry.summary: Nils Anderson Röed, the exchange’s global head of financial investigations, sat down with Decrypt’s Sander Lutz at Messari Mainnet 2024 to discuss how Binance is proactively dismantling criminal networks around the world, the strategy with which the crypto exchange is approaching sensitive conflicts in the Middle East, and more.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 212 - SEEDPHRASE TALKS ART!
entry.summary: Payrolls Higher than expected, Bitcoin reacts hard. Crypto sank early in the week as Middle East tensions spooked markets. Powell signals two more rate cuts this year. SUI leads L1s again, nears YTD high despite large unlock. Majority of FTX repayments still months away. EIGEN becomes non-transferable, hits $6bn FDV. SEC to appeal Ripple securities law ruling. Visa launches tokenization platform for banks. SWIFT plans digital asset trial in 2025. ByBit launched trading of global stock indices. SPX, GIGA & FWOG hit ATHs, most memes fall. XCOPY to release 250 piece collection on Shape. HBO documentary claims to have identified Satoshi.

entry.title: Altcoins bleed, ByBit launches stock index trading, POCHITA soars
entry.summary: Altcoins sink, BTC dominance nears cycle high. BTC in ‘three blind mice’ downtrend. Tron revenue hits record $577m in Q3. ByBit to launch trading of major stock indices. Franklin Templeton launch fund on APT. SWIFT banks to trial digital assets in 2025. Aerodrome hits $1bn TVL on Base. Cronje calls out Aerodrome for copyright. ETH ICO wallet sells $47m. SEC files appeal against Ripple ruling. EIGEN falls 20% on staking rewards FUD. FTX to auction off WLD position. Half of US voters think crypto ‘important’. North Korea ‘infiltrating’ crypto industry. Snowden challenged over SOL centralisation view. Top SEC official on crypto set to depart.

entry.title: DACOM Summit: Fastex CLO Vardan Khachatryan on Crypto Compliance
entry.summary: Fastex Chief Legal Officer Vardan Khachatryan joined Rug Radio creator Mlow at DACOM Summit to discuss how the crypto exchange is advancing compliance, and the regulatory challenges that lie ahead for the sector.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 210 - MIDDLE EAST TENSIONS RISE
entry.summary: Crypto drops as Middle East tensions flare. $500m liquidations in drop. BTC ETFs see largest outflows in a month. Fidelity ETH ETF sees 2nd highest outflow ever. SUI hits 6-month highs, bridge goes live on mainnet. Hashdex set to launch XRP ETF. Wormhole leads altcoin gains after Upbit lists. BTC miners hit record low profits in September Crypto hackers stole $750m in Q3. Telegram has been disclosing IPs since 2018.

entry.title: How Arbitrum is Simplifying Web3 for Web2 Adopters
entry.summary: Arbitrum's Head of Korea, John Park, joined Rug Radio creator Pukerainbow at ArbiVerse to talk about the Ethereum layer-2's strategy in Asia, hackathons, and bringing enterprise clients to its ecosystem.
